name: enchantment
content:
enchantment noun
(PLEASURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a feeling of great pleasure and attraction, especially because something is very beautiful: The audience looked on in utter fascination and enchantment. This is a place of enchantment and beauty.
[ C ] a very attractive and pleasing quality: How can I describe the many enchantments of this island?
More examplesFewer examplesShe creates a world of fairytale enchantment.The recording somehow enhances our sense of the beauty and enchantment of her voice.The museum is full of enchantments.

enchantment noun
(MAGIC)
[ C ] something that is thought to have magical power over someone: spells and enchantments
[ U ] the state of being under the influence of magic: Nothing could break through his enchantment.
More examplesFewer examplesI could not have run, even if I had wanted, because I was under an enchantment.Was she just telling a story - or was it an enchantment, her way of casting a spell? The witch beguiled the city with her enchantments.
